description: Rubric for validating data science methodology: cross-validation strategy, metric selection, statistical significance, baseline comparison, and evaluation completeness.

dimensions.name: cv_methodology
dimensions.description: Cross-validation strategy is appropriate for the data and problem type

dimensions.name: metric_selection
dimensions.description: Evaluation metrics are appropriate for the problem type and class distribution

dimensions.name: statistical_rigor
dimensions.description: Results include variance estimates and significance testing where applicable

dimensions.name: evaluation_completeness
dimensions.description: Multiple evaluation dimensions covered beyond primary metric

checks.name: cv_strategy_appropriateness
checks.description: Verify that the cross-validation strategy matches the data characteristics. Stratified K-Fold for imbalanced classification, TimeSeriesSplit for temporal data, GroupKFold when groups should not be split.

checks.name: metric_matches_problem
checks.description: Check that evaluation metrics are appropriate for the problem type. Accuracy alone is insufficient for imbalanced datasets; R2 alone is insufficient when scale of errors matters.

checks.name: baseline_comparison_present
checks.description: Verify that model performance is compared against a meaningful baseline (majority class, mean predictor, simple heuristic). Models must demonstrate clear improvement over naive approaches.

checks.name: cv_fold_count_sufficient
checks.description: Check that the number of CV folds is appropriate. Fewer than 3 folds provides unreliable estimates. More than 10 folds may be unnecessary for large datasets and wasteful for small ones.

checks.name: variance_reporting
checks.description: Verify that CV scores include both mean and standard deviation. Point estimates without variance are misleading and prevent comparing model stability.

checks.name: multi_metric_evaluation
checks.description: Check that evaluation includes multiple complementary metrics. Classification should include accuracy plus F1/precision/recall/AUC. Regression should include R2 plus MAE/RMSE.

checks.name: class_imbalance_handling
checks.description: For classification with imbalanced classes, verify that class-weighted or macro-averaged metrics are used, and that evaluation accounts for the imbalance rather than being dominated by majority class.

checks.name: conformal_calibration
checks.description: If uncertainty quantification is applied, verify that conformal prediction coverage matches target coverage rate. Miscalibrated uncertainty estimates are worse than none.

checks.name: robustness_evaluation
checks.description: Check that model robustness is evaluated through noise injection, feature perturbation, or similar adversarial testing. Models should degrade gracefully under realistic noise levels.

checks.name: fairness_evaluation_when_applicable
checks.description: When sensitive columns are identified, verify that per-group performance metrics are computed and fairness gaps are reported. Missing fairness evaluation when sensitive data is available is a methodology gap.

checks.name: reproducibility_seeding
checks.description: Verify that random seeds are set for all stochastic components (model initialization, CV splitting, data shuffling) to ensure reproducible results.
